data.title: 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare': First official trailer, release date, how Henry Cavill outfoxes Nazis
data.meta_description: In real life, the group of rogues and mavericks under Churchill helped turn the tide of the war with their "ungentlemanly" tactics. But, Guy Ritchie's film, 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare' will highlight the dangers of their mission while also reveling in the slight silliness of a ministry dedicated to underhanded operations. Know in detail and watch its first official trailer.
data.text:
Synopsis

In real life, the group of rogues and mavericks under Churchill helped turn the tide of the war with their "ungentlemanly" tactics. But, Guy Ritchie's film, 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare' will highlight the dangers of their mission while also reveling in the slight silliness of a ministry dedicated to underhanded operations. Know in detail and watch its first official trailer.

The first official trailer for 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare' has been released. It features high stakes, drama, and a pinch of Action director Guy Ritchie's signature comedy as Henry Cavill and his fellow elite soldiers battle the Nazis through unconventional means. Based on Damien Lewis's book 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare: How Churchill’s Secret Warriors Set Europe Ablaze and Gave Birth to Modern Black Ops', Ritchie, Arash Amel, Paul Tamasy, and Eric Johnson have co-written the script.

Story takes a different turn

But the story of the film takes a different turn. In real life, the group of rogues and mavericks under Churchill helped turn the tide of the war with their "ungentlemanly" tactics. But, Ritchie's film will highlight the dangers of their mission while also reveling in the slight silliness of a ministry dedicated to underhanded operations.

The brotherhood shared between the ragtag members is important as they sail to distant shores. With a look out of a different era, the film is gearing up to be both fun and enlightening.

Distinguished ensemble of stars

After portraying agent Napoleon Solo in 'The Man From U.N.C.L.E.', Cavill makes his second appearance in a Guy Ritchie film with 'Ungentlemanly Warfare'. Another important star is Eiza Gonzalez, who is set to lead a pair of other upcoming Ritchie projects, including the recently-announced heist film Fountain of Youth. Hero Fiennes Tiffin, Henry Golding, Alan Ritchson, Alex Pettyfer, Babs Olusamokun, Henrique Zaga, Til Schweiger, Henry Golding, and Cary Elwes join them.

Release date

'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare' will hit the theaters on April 19.

FAQs:

Who has written the script of 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare'?

Based on Damien Lewis's book 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare: How Churchill’s Secret Warriors Set Europe Ablaze and Gave Birth to Modern Black Ops', Ritchie, Arash Amel, Paul Tamasy, and Eric Johnson have co-written the script.

Who are the stars of 'The Ministry of Ungentlemanly Warfare'?

Henry Cavill makes his second appearance in a Guy Ritchie film with 'Ungentlemanly Warfare'. Another important star is Eiza Gonzalez. Hero Fiennes Tiffin, Henry Golding, Alan Ritchson, Alex Pettyfer, Babs Olusamokun, Henrique Zaga, Til Schweiger, Henry Golding, and Cary Elwes join them.
